In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    result *= "$line"
    return result
end
```

You can use the function like this:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
println(wrap_string(s))
```
This will print:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum dolor sit 
amet, consectetur adipiscing 
elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor 
incididunt ut labore et 
dolore magna aliqua."
```
